episodeTitle: Oars Roars! Come Out, Straw Hat Crew
description: Oars, the massive zombie animated by Luffy's shadow, receives orders from Moria to hunt down every Straw Hat Pirate. As the giant rampages across Thriller Bark, he disrupts multiple battles and forces the scattered crew members to unite against this overwhelming threat.

events.title: Cindry's Humanity Resurfaces
events.description: Despite being a zombie under Hogback's control, Cindry refuses to obey his command to rescue him. She smiles warmly at Chopper, revealing a moment of her original personality breaking through the zombie programming.
events.significance: Demonstrates that shadows and zombie bodies can retain traces of their original humanity and conscience. This moment provides emotional weight to the tragedy of Hogback's twisted resurrection of the woman he loved.

quotes.text: Cindry... why won't you move?! Save me!
quotes.speaker: Hogback
quotes.context: Hogback desperately ordering Cindry to rescue him as he's trapped

events.title: Pierna Fleur Debuts
events.description: Robin debuts her Pierna Fleur (Leg Flower) technique, sprouting multiple legs from the ground to create a platform that elevates Chopper for their combination attack.
events.significance: Expands Robin's Devil Fruit repertoire by showing she can sprout legs as well as arms. Sets up the combination technique with Chopper.

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin calling out her new technique

events.title: Robi-Cho Suplex Attempted
events.description: Chopper and Robin attempt their first combination technique, the Robi-Cho Suplex. Robin uses Pierna Fleur to create a tower of legs, elevating Chopper in Heavy Point to a great height. However, before Chopper can complete the suplex on Hogback, Oars crashes through the mansion, interrupting the attack.
events.significance: Introduces the first named combination technique between Robin and Chopper, demonstrating the crew's growing teamwork and tactical coordination. Though interrupted, it foreshadows more combination attacks.

events.title: Oars Begins Hunting the Straw Hats
events.description: Moria gives Oars explicit orders to capture and destroy every member of the Straw Hat crew. He provides Oars with the crew's wanted posters attached to his arm as reference. Oars begins his rampage through Thriller Bark, actively seeking out each crew member.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the major climactic battle of the Thriller Bark arc. Establishes Oars as the primary physical threat that will require the entire crew's cooperation to defeat.

quotes.text: Oars! Capture and destroy every Straw Hat Pirate! Here are their faces!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria commanding Oars and showing him the wanted posters

events.title: Luffy Pursues Moria
events.description: While Oars rampages through Thriller Bark, Luffy remains focused on his goal of catching Gecko Moria directly. He chases after Moria, determined to defeat the mastermind rather than fight the zombies.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's tactical thinking and determination to target the root of the problem. This separates him from the rest of the crew's battle against Oars.

events.title: Hogback Crushed by Oars
events.description: As Oars crashes through the mansion, the mad doctor Hogback is trampled and crushed beneath the massive zombie's feet and the collapsing building debris. Cindry watches but does not attempt to save him.
events.significance: Delivers poetic justice to Hogback for his twisted experiments and mistreatment of the dead. His defeat by his own side's ultimate weapon underscores the uncontrollable nature of Oars.

events.title: Sanji vs Absalom Battle Interrupted
events.description: Just as Sanji is gaining the upper hand in his fight against Absalom, Oars' rampage disrupts their battle. The sudden chaos creates an opening for Absalom to escape.
events.significance: Prevents Sanji from achieving victory and rescuing Nami, prolonging the conflict and creating more tension in the arc.

events.title: Absalom Recaptures Nami
events.description: Taking advantage of the distraction caused by Oars, Absalom uses his invisibility to recapture the unconscious Nami. He declares he will properly wed her this time without any interruptions.
events.significance: Raises the stakes for Sanji and creates urgency for the crew to defeat both Oars and rescue Nami before Absalom can carry out his plans.

quotes.text: This time I'll wed her properly, without any disturbances!
quotes.speaker: Absalom
quotes.context: Absalom capturing Nami during the chaos

events.title: Straw Hats Recognize Luffy's Zombie
events.description: Zoro, Franky, and Brook encounter the massive Oars and immediately recognize that the zombie possesses Luffy's shadow. They realize they're facing a combination of Luffy's abilities and personality in a giant's body.
events.significance: The crew's recognition of Luffy in Oars adds emotional complexity to the battle - they must fight what is essentially a twisted version of their captain.

quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro recognizing Luffy's shadow in Oars

events.title: Oars Uses Gomu Gomu no Kane
events.description: Oars demonstrates Luffy's fighting techniques by attempting to use Gomu Gomu no Kane (Gum-Gum Bell), though he cannot actually stretch. The attack still causes massive destruction due to his enormous size and strength.
events.significance: Shows that Oars has access to Luffy's combat knowledge and instincts, even though he lacks the rubber body. This makes him unpredictable and dangerous as he combines giant strength with Luffy's fighting style.

quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars attempting to use Luffy's technique

events.title: All Straw Hats Gather Against Oars
events.description: Sanji, Usopp, Chopper, and Robin join Zoro, Franky, and Brook as the entire present Straw Hat crew (minus the unconscious Nami and pursuing Luffy) assembles to face the threat of Oars together.
events.significance: Represents the unity and cooperation of the Straw Hat crew when facing overwhelming odds. Sets up the crew battle against Oars.

events.title: Oars Challenges the Straw Hats
events.description: The episode concludes with Oars roaring out a challenge for the Straw Hat Pirates to come out and fight him. The crew stands ready to face this enormous threat together.
events.significance: Creates the cliffhanger ending that sets up the major crew battle in the following episodes. Establishes the David vs Goliath dynamic of the coming fight.

quotes.text: Come out, Straw Hat crew! Fight me!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars' challenge at the episode's climax

quotes.text: Cindry... why won't you move?! Save me!
quotes.speaker: Hogback
quotes.context: Hogback desperately ordering Cindry to rescue him

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin calling out her new technique

quotes.text: Oars! Capture and destroy every Straw Hat Pirate! Here are their faces!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria commanding Oars with the wanted posters

quotes.text: This time I'll wed her properly, without any disturbances!
quotes.speaker: Absalom
quotes.context: Absalom capturing Nami during the chaos

quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro recognizing Luffy's shadow in Oars

quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars attempting to use Luffy's technique

quotes.text: Come out, Straw Hat crew! Fight me!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars' challenge at the episode's climax

themes.description: The Straw Hat crew must unite to face the massive threat of Oars, demonstrating that cooperation and teamwork are essential when facing seemingly impossible challenges.
themes.symbolism: Oars represents an overwhelming force that cannot be defeated alone. The crew's assembly symbolizes their bond and mutual reliance.

themes.description: Cindry's moment of refusing to save Hogback shows that even in death and resurrection, traces of humanity and free will can resist forced control.
themes.symbolism: Cindry's smile to Chopper represents the enduring nature of the human spirit, even when trapped in an undead form.

themes.description: Hogback's defeat at the hands of Oars, another product of his twisted science, represents the danger of manipulating life and death without respect for the natural order.
themes.symbolism: Hogback being crushed by his own side's ultimate creation serves as poetic justice for his crimes against nature.

characterSpotlights.development: Oars fully begins his role as the major physical threat of the arc, actively hunting the Straw Hats on Moria's orders.
keyActions: Receives orders from Moria to destroy all Straw Hats
Crashes through the mansion, interrupting multiple battles
Uses Gomu Gomu no Kane technique
Challenges the assembled Straw Hat crew to battle
quotes: Come out, Straw Hat crew! Fight me!

characterSpotlights.development: Cindry's original personality breaks through the zombie programming, showing her humanity still exists beneath Hogback's control.
keyActions: Refuses to obey Hogback's order to save him
Allows Hogback to be defeated without intervening

characterSpotlights.development: Robin expands her combat capabilities with new leg-based techniques and demonstrates teamwork with Chopper.
keyActions: Attempts Robi-Cho Suplex combination with Chopper
Joins the crew to face Oars

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper shows tactical coordination with Robin and witnesses Cindry's humanity, providing emotional closure to their subplot.
keyActions: Joins the crew to face Oars

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scenes of Oars crashing through various locations and interrupting battles for more dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 469 (pages 2-19) of the manga, titled 'Pirate Luffy vs. God-Fearing Soldier Oars'.
Both Luffy and Oars are voiced by Mayumi Tanaka in Japanese and Colleen Clinkenbeard in English, with distorted voice effects used for Oars.
The Robi-Cho Suplex is one of the few named combination techniques between Straw Hat crew members in the series.
This episode aired on August 3, 2008 in Japan but didn't reach US audiences via Toonami until October 8, 2016, over 8 years later.
